unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reported a surge in neurology cases this week, particularly among young adults aged 25-35 yrs. Dr. Meena Krishnan, HoD of Neurology, attributes this to increased stress levels & poor sleep hygiene. 60% of the patients presented with severe headaches & migraines.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reported a surge in neurology cases this week, particularly among young adults aged twenty five to thirty five years. Doctor Meena Krishnan, H-o-D of Neurology, attributes this to increased stress levels and poor sleep hygiene. sixty percent of the patients presented with severe headaches and migraines.

unnormalised: The hospital saw approx. 150 cases, up from the usual 100, in the past 7 days. "We're seeing a disturbing trend," Dr. Krishnan commented. "Many patients delay seeking help, self-medicating with OTC painkillers, which worsens the problem."
normalised: The hospital saw approximately one hundred and fifty cases, up from the usual one hundred, in the past seven days. "We are seeing a disturbing trend," Doctor Krishnan commented. "Many patients delay seeking help, self-medicating with O-T-C painkillers, which worsens the problem."

unnormalised: One such case was that of Rohan Sharma, a 28-year-old software engineer from Gurgaon. He experienced persistent headaches for 3 months before finally consulting a neurologist at AIIMS. His MRI scan revealed signs of early-stage migraine.
normalised: One such case was that of Rohan Sharma, a twenty eight year old software engineer from Gurgaon. He experienced persistent headaches for three months before finally consulting a neurologist at A-I-I-M-S. His M-R-I scan revealed signs of early stage migraine.

unnormalised: Another patient, Aisha Khan, 32, a teacher from Old Delhi, was admitted with vertigo & nausea. She had been ignoring her symptoms for almost 6 months, attributing it to "stress from Diwali preparations." Doctors diagnosed her with vestibular neuritis.
normalised: Another patient, Aisha Khan, thirty two, a teacher from Old Delhi, was admitted with vertigo and nausea. She had been ignoring her symptoms for almost six months, attributing it to "stress from Diwali preparations." Doctors diagnosed her with vestibular neuritis.

unnormalised: The neurology department is urging people to seek professional help immediately if they experience persistent headaches, dizziness, numbness, or any other neurological symptoms. "Early diagnosis and treatment can prevent serious complications," advised Dr. Patel, a senior consultant.
normalised: The neurology department is urging people to seek professional help immediately if they experience persistent headaches, dizziness, numbness, or any other neurological symptoms. unnormalised: AIIMS has ramped up its outpatient services to handle the increased influx of patients. The hospital is also planning to launch an awareness campaign on the importance of neurological health. They are aiming to reach at least 10,000 people in Delhi NCR.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S has ramped up its outpatient services to handle the increased influx of patients. The hospital is also planning to launch an awareness campaign on the importance of neurological health. They are aiming to reach at least ten thousand people in Delhi N-C-R.

unnormalised: To combat the rising cases, AIIMS is recommending lifestyle changes like regular exercise, adequate sleep (7-8 hrs), & stress management techniques like yoga & meditation. The hospital is also planning to start a specialized clinic for young adults with neurological disorders.
